turns.content: Here are some staples of Hong Kong/Cantonese style home cooked meals. 蠔油菜心, 蒸水蛋, 蒸魚, 柱侯牛腩, 豉油雞, 腐乳通菜, 鹹蛋蒸肉餅. Do you know of more examples like these? Looking for home style meals speficially, not restaurant meals. Give me a few names.

Sure, here are some more examples of home-style Cantonese dishes:

1. 炒蛋炆蝦仁 (Stir-fried eggs with shrimp)
2. 煎釀茄子 (Pan-fried stuffed eggplant)
3. 蒜蓉粉絲蒸扇貝 (Steamed scallops with garlic vermicelli)
4. 酥炸雞翼 (Deep-fried chicken wings)
5. 紅燒牛腩 (Braised beef brisket)
6. 清炒芥蘭 (Stir-fried Chinese broccoli)
7. 炆排骨 (Braised pork ribs)
8. 煮豆腐 (Braised tofu)
9. 炒青菜 (Stir-fried vegetables)
10. 煲仔飯 (Claypot rice)

I hope this helps!
Ok, good enough for now. Are you familiar with Blue Apron, Hello Fresh and similar services? Do you know why they are popular and what are some of their popular dishes? Give me some names.

Yes, I'm familiar with Blue Apron, Hello Fresh, and similar meal kit delivery services. They are popular because they provide an easy and convenient way for people to cook their own meals at home without having to shop for ingredients or plan out menus. The meals are pre-portioned, which minimizes waste and saves time on prep work.

Some popular dishes from Blue Apron and Hello Fresh include:

1. Blue Apron's Harissa Shrimp & Carrot Tagine with Couscous
2. Hello Fresh's Chickpea-Powered Mediterranean Couscous Bowl
3. Blue Apron's Chicken Tinga Tacos with Avocado & Radish Salsa
4. Hello Fresh's Garlic-Parmesan Crusted Salmon with Roasted Potatoes and Green Beans
5. Blue Apron's Korean-Style Pork & Rice Cakes with Baby Bok Choy & Carrots
6. Hello Fresh's Creamy Lemon Butter Chicken with Garlic and Herb Rice
7. Blue Apron's Seared Cod & Miso Udon Noodles with Baby Bok Choy & Soft-Boiled Eggs
8. Hello Fresh's Balsamic Fig Chicken with Roasted Green Beans and Couscous
9. Blue Apron's Pan-Seared Steaks & Garlic Mashed Potatoes with Roasted Broccoli
10. Hello Fresh's Sizzling Prawn & Chorizo Spaghetti with Tomato Sauce

I hope this helps!

Ok, now combine the two. We are launching a similar meal kit service for the Hong Kong market. Hong Kongers are primarily used to Cantonese style home cooked meals, but can also be adventurous eaters due to the international influences. Some of the most iconic dishes in Hong Kong are actually "fusion" 茶餐廳 dishes before fusion was cool.

Like the western counterparts, we want this service to focus on quick and easy meals, with (sometimes simplified versions) of the everyday staples, but also encourages the customers to explore new and interesting techniques, flavors, ingredients and twists. 

The dishes should be quick and easy to prepare, with few enough steps that can fit on a recipe card that can be followed even by relatively inexperienced home cooks. It should also work with ingredients that can be shipped in an ice box. With that in mind, create 15 dishes that fits everything we talked about. Use Chinese names for the dishes.3 / 3

Sure, here are 15 Cantonese-style home cooked meal kit dishes that are quick and easy to prepare, use ingredients that can be shipped in an ice box, and encourage customers to explore new and interesting flavors and techniques:

1. 蒜茸牛油炒蝦仁 (Garlic Butter Shrimp)
2. 金沙脆皮雞 (Crispy Salted Egg Chicken)
3. 豉汁蒸魚 (Steamed Fish with Black Bean Sauce)
4. 酸辣湯 (Hot and Sour Soup)
5. 炒四季豆 (Stir-fried Green Beans)
6. 燒肉飯 (Roast Pork Rice Bowl)
7. 紅燒牛肉 (Braised Beef in Soy Sauce)
8. 菜脯蛋炒飯 (Egg Fried Rice with Preserved Vegetables)
9. 雞絲粥 (Chicken Congee with Ginger and Scallions)
10. 芝士焗蘑菇 (Baked Mushrooms with Cheese)
11. 咖哩牛肉飯 (Curry Beef Rice Bowl)
12. 香蒜蒸扇貝 (Garlic Steamed Scallops)
13. 肉鬆蛋炒飯 (Egg Fried Rice with Pork Floss)
14. 肉末炒蛋 (Stir-fried Eggs with Minced Pork)
15. 粉絲蒸肉餅 (Steamed Pork Patty with Vermicelli)

I hope these dish ideas fit your criteria and provide some inspiration for your meal kit service launch in Hong Kong!
More creative twists and more variety. Think the Blue Apron and Hello Fresh kind of dishes but for our target market

Certainly! Here are some additional Cantonese-style home cooked meal kit dishes with creative twists and a variety of flavors:

1. 叉燒菜飯 (Char Siu Vegetable Fried Rice) - A twist on the classic char siu rice bowl, this dish adds extra veggies to create a more balanced meal.
2. 咖喱雞扒 (Curried Chicken Cutlet) - A crispy chicken cutlet with a fragrant curry sauce, served with rice or noodles.
3. 炸醬面 (Zha Jiang Noodles) - A popular dish from northern China, this Cantonese version features a savory and slightly sweet meat sauce served over noodles.
4. 煎釀茄子 (Stuffed Pan-fried Eggplant) - Soft and silky eggplant stuffed with a flavorful meat filling, pan-fried until crispy on the outside.
5. 鹹魚炒雞粒 (Salted Fish and Chicken Stir-fry) - A classic Cantonese dish with a bold umami flavor from the salted fish.
6. 蒜香炒西蘭花 (Garlic Stir-fried Broccoli) - A simple and healthy dish that's quick to prepare, with tender-crisp broccoli tossed in garlicky oil.
7. 蜜汁叉燒包 (Honey-glazed Char Siu Bao) - Soft and fluffy steamed buns filled with sweet and savory char siu.
8. 黑椒牛柳粒 (Black Pepper Beef Cubes) - Tender beef cubes tossed in a bold and peppery sauce, served with rice or noodles.
9. 薑蔥龍利球 (Ginger Scallion Lobster Balls) - Succulent lobster meat mixed with ginger, scallions, and other seasonings, formed into balls and steamed until tender.
10. 烏魚子蒸蛋 (Steamed Egg with Bottarga) - A luxurious and umami-rich version of the classic steamed egg dish, with the addition of cured fish roe.
11. 廣式煎粉果 (Cantonese-style Pan-fried Rice Flour Rolls) - Thin and tender rice flour rolls filled with savory pork and veggies, pan-fried until crispy on the outside.
12. 芝士培根焗糯米飯 (Cheesy Bacon Baked Sticky Rice) - A comforting and indulgent dish featuring sticky rice baked with bacon and cheese until golden and bubbly.
13. 咕嚕肉丁 (Sweet and Sour Pork) - A classic Chinese dish with crispy-fried pork tossed in a tangy and sweet sauce.
14. 粟米雞片湯 (Creamy Corn and Chicken Soup) - A comforting soup made with fresh corn and tender chicken, finished with a touch of cream for richness.
15. 豉椒牛柳 (Stir-fried Beef with Black Bean Sauce and Chili) - A spicy and flavorful dish with tender beef strips, aromatic black bean sauce, and fiery chili peppers.
